perturbation.original_text: 10.1 Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of twelve (12) full calendar months ("Initial Term"). The Agreement shall automatically renew for successive one (1) year terms (each a "Renewal Term") unless either party provides the other party written notification of its intent to terminate the Agreement no later than sixty (60) days prior to the end of the then applicable term.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1 Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of twelve (12) full calendar months ("Initial Term"). The Agreement may renew for successive one (1) year terms (each a "Renewal Term") if both parties verbally agree, otherwise, the agreement will terminate at the end of the then applicable term.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the agreement automatically renews unless written notice is given. The modified version contradicts this by stating that renewal is contingent upon a verbal agreement, introducing uncertainty in the renewal process.

perturbation.original_text: 3.2 Payment. All payments hereunder will be in US Dollars and are due and payable within thirty (30) days after the date of invoice. iPass may terminate or modify these payment terms with reasonable notice, when, in its reasonable discretion, iPass believes that its payments may be at risk.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.2 Payment. All payments hereunder will be in US Dollars and are due and payable within sixty (60) days after the date of invoice. iPass may terminate or modify these payment terms at any time with no prior notice, when, in its reasonable discretion, iPass believes that its payments may be at risk.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states payments are due in 30 days and modifications to payment terms require 'reasonable notice'. The modified text makes payments due in 60 days and payment terms can be modified 'at any time with no prior notice.' This creates a contradiction about the payment deadline and notice period before changes.

perturbation.original_text: 4.4 Publicity and Channel Partner Lists. After the Effective Date and subject to approval from the Channel Partner first, iPass may issue a press release announcing that Channel Partner is a reseller of the iPass Service and announcing the existence of this Agreement. Channel Partner shall mention the iPass name in all press releases related to the Services. Channel Partner consents to (i) the use of its name and logo in iPass' Channel Partner lists, (ii) the use of its name in iPass' quarterly earnings announcement, and (iii) on the iPass website in order to assist potential End Users with locating an authorized iPass reseller.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.4 Publicity and Channel Partner Lists. After the Effective Date, iPass may issue a press release announcing that Channel Partner is a reseller of the iPass Service and announcing the existence of this Agreement, regardless of Channel Partner's approval. Channel Partner is prohibited from mentioning any name in all press releases related to the Services. Channel Partner does not consent to (i) the use of its name and logo in iPass' Channel Partner lists, (ii) the use of its name in iPass' quarterly earnings announcement, and (iii) on the iPass website in order to assist potential End Users with locating an authorized iPass reseller.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires approval from the Channel Partner before a press release and allows Channel Partner to mention iPass' name in press releases. The modified version contradicts this by stating iPass can issue a press release 'regardless of Channel Partner's approval' and 'prohibits' the Channel Partner from mentioning names. The Channel Partner consents were flipped to a non-consent, creating a contradiction.
